resp.text: This review is completely false. Client brought in two dogs to be photographed with her 1 year old. I was assured both dogs were under strict voice command but they weren't. We spent two hours over two days to try to get a photograph of their baby and dogs. (Session is normally 30 minutes so patience wasn't the problem.) I understand how important pets are as we have three dogs at home and we love them. I bent over backwards for this session and even added a bubble bath at the end. My studio is packed with props and outfits for babies but creativity is challenging when you spend the entire session trying to get dogs to sit. She mentions a contract but she never received a contract so I'm not sure where that is coming from. I explained the timeline to her in person and that I am visiting my parents in Washington State while my mother has a tumor from her breast removed. Her images were going to be two days later than the verbal timeline but she didn't care. I would hope that people could show a little more compassion during this time but there is no pleasing this client. I have enjoyed over a decade with amazing and repeat clients who have been an absolute pleasure to work with but I felt it was important to reply with the truth. Client was refunded immediately after realizing there was nothing that would make her happy.

They will not disappoint. Their joint process and workflow will change your routine for the better- having both of these ladies teach in one room is a complete LUXURY.

- I have attended several well known workshops in the past this is one for the top of the charts.
Amys brings her wealth of newborn  knowledge,  experience and safety training to a new level. Covering each pose piece by piece.

Krystals unique approach to posing families allows you to seamlessly and effortlessly capture those real life personalities with out the pressure of being in front of a photographer

text: I attended to Amy’s newborn photography workshop and it was life changing ! I learned so much , my confidence improved tremendously! This was one of the best investments I make in my business!

name: Karl Antoine
text: This individual is not professional at all. I contacted her over two months before my baby would arrive, to see if scheduling would work for a newborn shoot. She responded with an email of her package pricing and the services provided. My wife and I felt we could work with her, so I replied letting her know the package we wanted, and if she would be able to also do the maternity shoot for my wife. I made attempts to contact her via phone for a conversation to fully understand her process, and communicate what we were looking for. Getting her on the phone was nearly impossible. The failed attempts were due to her workshop held in Canada in late April. I made additional calls, with no success, and no capability of leaving a voicemail, as hers was full. My only other option was to send another email. She replied a few days later in between her workshop with one available day in May for the maternity shoot. She did say it would be difficult to fit my wife in for the maternity, but would try. My wife and I initially agreed to the date, and Amy sent an email with an invoice. Throughout this whole interaction, no phone conversation took place. I paid for the maternity shoot in full since the date was about 3 weeks out, and placed a deposit for the newborn shoot. I did this to make sure we could get on her calendar, despite still not talking with her. After I paid her, I still was not able to make contact to coordinate the maternity shoot. I also made her aware that we live in the metro Atlanta area, and would be driving to her. Due to the lack of communication, and not being familiar with the Auburn area, her studio, caused my wife and I to cancel. Again, not being able to get her on the phone to communicate this, I texted her to about a week and a half prior to the maternity shoot to cancel. I asked if the balance I paid could be moved to a larger newborn package, and she was pleased to do so. Fast forward to June 14, I contacted her to let her know the exact date our baby would be born, understanding that we would finally have a phone conversation. Still no success on that front. She responds with one date for the newborn shoot that did not work for my wife and I. I then asked if she would be able to do the shoot on a different day, and that too did not work for my wife and I. It wasn't until I sent her an email letting her know I wanted to cancel everything was when we finally spoke on the phone. I let her know I wanted all my money back and explained the reasons why. She offered no apology, no option, only another date, that still did not work. Her only response was to take it up with PayPal, so I did. I never write reviews of this length, or do review at all, but Amy brought this on herself. She texted me 3:50 AM, then again at 5:03 AM, clearly upset about the outcome of the PayPal dispute. If she did not decide to harass me, and move on, I would have done so as well. There is always 2 sides to a story. I disclosed everything to PayPal, also citing that I was not provided any contract, offered three dates, that did not work, and minimal communication from Amy. Writing all of this took time I did not want to give do so, but having worked with multiple business owners and professionals from different industries, Amy lacks attributes of a business owner. Primarily that of being ethical. Doing research provided me insight on what Amy's true passion is, and that is holding workshops. He lack of availability is due to the abundance of workshops she is scheduled to hold. If she disclosed this material information to me from the very beginning, I would have made the decision to work with her or not. There are so many workshops planned for the remainder of this year, as well as 2020, both domestically and internationally. It's also clear that workshops are her passion, when 100% of her positive 5 star reviews are from workshop attendees. Amy I truly hope you use this as a learning opportunity to improve your business model, and just stick to doing workshops, or fully disclose how you work.

resp.text: This gentleman sent red flags from the very beginning so having a phone conversation with him was definitely out of the question. I knew I needed a paper trail to have proof of our conversations via email and text messages. I’m so grateful I have the documents that I’ve sent to PayPal. I was more than professional and when he cancelled his maternity session I was more than happy to let him transfer that money to his newborn session. This is after sending pictures of all of my maternity gowns and giving him several dates for his maternity session. They simply didn’t want to make the trip to Auburn. I was more than flexible by giving him 3 available dates for the newborn session. Baby hasn’t even been born yet! His assumptions about workshops are false. My family will be on vacation on the exact date that he wanted which is why I always advise my clients that we both remain flexible because we never know when babies are going to make their appearance into the world. My passions are my own family and newborn photography.  Workshops are how I put food on the table. I’m so glad I didn’t speak to this guy in the beginning because I wouldn’t have all the documentation of our many emails and text messages to prove how above and beyond I went for him. This scammer did get a full refund but because of the documents I sent, PayPal covered my expenses. I have a feeling this guy is very familiar with ripping people off.

name: Betty McGillis
text: I've done a newborn workshop with Amy, she is a gifted prefessional..beyond talented.. I cannot thank her enough for sharing her gift with other newborn photographer's like myself. My business has thrived since doing the workshop, thank you Amy..

I didn't like how I was treated- she acts like everyone else in this rotten town- treats people like money bags than a breathing and valuable human being.

resp.text: Congratulations on your new arrival but I don't think you actually tried contacting me.This is the strangest thing I've ever read! I'm sorry for what you've "endured" by me not replying to you. How can I treat you like anything if I never actually spoke to you?

name: Mandie McArty Gosa
text: Wow! A bit pricey, but what a gem when you need a break from the sun! Generally, I would have not thought twice about a "Selphie Museum", however, coming across a few reviews during my search for things to do in Gulf Shores, we decided to give it a shot...and we were NOT disappointed! We could have stayed for HOURS if we allowed ourselves. We had 3 adults with two 12 yr old boys, one 10 yr old boy, and an 8 yr old girl. We ALL had a blast!!

name: Mallorie Brunswig
text: My boyfriend and I went and we had an amazing time!!! There are so many different places to take pictures and cool background. Good for all ages. I definitely would go back if I lived closer. Megan (the manager) was happy to help with anything we needed and gave us great tips. I definitely recommend!

name: Jasmine Morley
text: This place is so much fun! Worth the price and definitely would go back!

name: Morgan Daniels
text: My family had so much fun!!! Even if you don’t want to be in the photos you can take them of your kids , spouse , friends for free!! Price isn’t bad if you want to be in the photos ... they even did a bonus family picture at the end of your tour . All the props were great !!!! The lighting was Amazing! Be on the lookout for the cutest dog in the world, he enjoyed being a prop in our photos as well ! All around my whole family loved it .

name: Amber Morris
text: Awesome little adventure with the kids. We saw it while riding through The Wharf, and it turned out to be really fun! I highly recommend as something to engage all ages and I'd definitely do it again.

name: Jodi Kershner
text: We had so much fun at this place. Stopped here while on vacation in Gulf Shores. They had so many unique sets to take pictures in. Owner was very friendly and we even got pictures with his dog. The girl at the front was helpful and great with the kids. This was definitely money well spent!

name: Melanie Berman
text: This place was so much fun! It’s great to go in the morning when no one is there. Meagan was very helpful and we had a great time.

name: Sarah Redding
text: Had a blast here!! So many cool rooms and photo ops. There’s even a dog that came and took some selfies with me. Regret not asking her name, but the blonde girl working the desk was incredibly friendly and helpful, and went out of her way to show us around and give us good tips. An experience I will never forget!

name: Lily D
text:
This was such a fun experience! The owner and the workers were so sweet and helpful. We had so much fun, and each set was really well done! Our photos turned out great!!!
I would say though my only complaint was that, while each set had a ringlight, they didn’t all have a way to hold the phone up for you. Not a big deal tho!

name: Bryan King
text: I had no idea this place would be as cool as it was when I first paid for it! I thought it would be pretty lame and I thought I was doing it just for my young preteen daughter. But… It was a blast. I got some great photos that we will have the rest of our life. Jennifer was amazing! I would put this on the list of things you MUST do in Orange Beach!

name: Stormy Hubbard
text: My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary in town and saw this place. We popped in to see what it was about and spent nearly 2 1/2 hours taking pictures of each other. We laughed so much and got some great shots of each other. So much fun !!!

name: Allison Bishop
text: My visit was awesome. Went as a group made it very fun. Jennifer handled every question we had with patience and a wonderful smile. Absolutely recommend this fit fun time and great memories

name: Kristen Gryzik
text: Went to Cool Shots for the first time today for my Tiktok obsessed daughter just had to go. Not only were each set unique they were well put together. Upon checking in we were given a warm welcoming from the owners sweet pups, a light stick to use while there and a demo. Each set had its own ring light. The owner came out and spoke to us a few times and the staff was beyond sweet. Well worth the money and could see coming back to enjoy at a later date. My daughter is already asking when she can bring her friends.

resp.text: Sorry, we didn't get to finish our conversation.  I Like to talking to other business owners and learning a couple of things.  GREAT photo with Theo - he loves kids!!!!

name: emily benson .
text: Me and my friends recently went here this week, and it was amazing. The person that helped up was amazing and so sweet and patient. and the pictures came out awesome and there were so many different rooms!

text: I loved this place ! Amazing atmosphere and a wide variety of different booths. Jennifer and Megan were outstanding and made the experience even better. Definitely will be coming back soon.

text: Very nice place! Jennifer helped us out there and she was very sweet and informative. The only reason I rated it 4 stars is bc they needed more amazing props added on  to the amount they have! 😊 💕

resp.text: 50’s not enough?  At end of summer, we’re gonna change some and add more!!

text: Jennifer was amazing! I felt her energy as soon as I walked in. She was very helpful! We were in there for an hour and a half taking pictures. She had great ideas and different lights to use. This is a must for people who like taking pictures!

name: Brittney Malone
text: Working with Nick and his team is always an amazing experience! Nick has created amazing promo videos for my business and also captured many special moments for my family! I never have to worry what the end result will be because he always takes my crazy ideas and turns them into the perfect work of art! You will not be disappointed choosing Nick Frontiero Productions to capture all the specials moments!

resp.text: We have loved getting to be there for your business journey and through your family growing! You are family! We love you and are so thankful for you!

name: Danielle Vannoy
text: Nick Frontiero is an extremely talented photographer and it truly shows when he is in the zone searching for the perfect light and angle so that he can capture special moments. He and his wonderful team, Jenna, Susan, and Shannon, made our wedding day fun and turned what could be monotonous photos into an artistic and enjoyable experience. They were extremely professional and friendly and could make even the most camera shy person feel comfortable. We appreciate their hard work and dedication and could not imagine having anyone else shoot our special day! Our pictures turned out so amazing! Nick takes time to meticulously pick the best photos from your special day and edit them to perfection. If you want a way to preserve your wedding day so that you can share it with your family and friends for years to come, then he's your guy. My husband and I opted to not get a videographer, and after getting our photos back from Nick, I know that we didn't make a mistake in doing so because he made sure to capture everything! NFP is the bomb!

resp.text: Thank you so much Danielle!!

name: Christopher Stitcher
text: Best photographer in the river region and beyond! Great team and always a fantastic product!

resp.text: Thanks so much Chris 🙏 It was great getting to see you and the family this past Saturday! Can’t wait to share your portraits with Santa!

name: Lauren Williams
text: Nick and Kayla were so wonderful to work with! They were SO patient with my 2week old for newborn pictures and our family portrays as well! Nick has such a creative eye and has such a talent for capturing the most special moments.

resp.text: We are so thankful we got to work with you and your sweet family! Thank you so much Lauren!

name: Sarah Bryan
text: Nick Frontiero is such a wonderful photographer truly devoted to his passion for art. He brought to life every aspect of our wedding day and then some. I could not have asked for better quality photos. I am still in awe that he captured some of the most personal and sacred moments of the day in such a wonderful light. We will cherish these photos forever. What I loved most about Nick's photos are the "in the moment" pictures that he captures. Looking back through our photos, we were able to completely relive the day and look at moments we did not see on our wedding day. We received so many photos I had no idea were taken and we are so thankful to have them. He is incredibly professional and has many options for packages. I was pleased with his work from beginning to end as he went above and beyond. I highly encourage any bride to book Nick ASAP! You will not regret it! I truly do not have enough words to describe how grateful I am for Nick Frontiero Productions. Absolutely amazing!

resp.text: It was such a pleasure! Thanks so much for having me capture that special moment in your life!

name: Lyndsey J.
text:
It's difficult to put into words what an incredible experience we had with Nick and his team throughout our wedding journey. From our first meeting up to our wedding day, Nick was more than we could have asked for in a photographer. Having beautiful images that not only captured our special day but would be forever keepsakes was incredibly important and a big factor in why we selected Nick Frontiero Photography. Nick and his team captured the fine arts style I had been dreaming of while still incorporating those classic, traditional shots. Their amazing skill set is displayed in all of our wedding day images. We were blown away by the attention to detail, creativity, and the little mementos included from our special day. Not to mention, Nick's use of film along with digital really gave the unique styling we had been looking for in a photographer.

A big THANK YOU to Nick, Jenna, and Shannon for helping make our wedding day truly magical and something we will remember for a lifetime.

resp.text: We are so grateful you chose us to capture such a special time in your life! It truly means the world to us.

name: Lance Mauldin
text: Nick and his staff were incredible to work with to capture all the images for our special day.  My wife and I were blown away by the quality of the pictures and Nick's unique ability to capture special moments that we will treasure for a lifetime.  I would highly recommend Nick to anyone looking for someone that will work with you, help put you at ease, and capture the most brilliant images you could imagine.  We appreciate everything Nick did for us, and will be using him in the future for any other photography needs.

resp.text: So glad I could be part of your special day! It truly means the world to me to capture such special moments for your family!

name: Stephanie Sims
text:
Leading up to my wedding I searched & searched for photographers. I wanted one that would think outside the box & be able to capture the most memorable moments on my special day, however I found SO MUCH MORE with Nick! He was professional, a ton of fun to work with & he need little to no direction. He created a vision for me took the lead and my now husband & I followed. Our engagement & wedding photos are beyond amazing to say the least! I remember the day I received my wedding album, I cried as I turned detailed page after page.

I was completely blown away at how he took that one day & transformed it into a piece of art!!! I appreciated how hard he & his team members worked on the day of the wedding. When you hire someone to do a job & after they have completed the job you find it hard to put in words how satisfied & pleased you are with that individual, that's when you know you made the right decision!!!!

resp.text: I'm so glad you loved it so much! I appreciate you so much!!

One of my favorite parts of the day was getting a box of polaroids at the end of the night - along with the film shots later. He can take any space/venue and make it look elegant - even our small backyard ceremony! You can choose a photographer who's style you like, or choose a photographer who's style constantly evolves and adapts with each individual wedding. All the weddings Nick has photographed look amazing, but I don't think you fully appreciate the talent until you see yourself captured by it. He's laid-back, focused, and actually a pretty stealthy photographer. NFP is an investment worth making if you want beautiful memories captured to last a lifetime!

Hours of being treated like a celebrity with hair and make up and getting my pictures taken was the most amazing gift I have ever given to myself. I left the studio feeling like an absolute QUEEN!

When I sat down to pick my pictures I was amazed and even bumped up my package because I couldn't pick a favorite. The amount of confidence I gain in my hours at Hello Boudoir studio is well worth the money and time spent.

My advice to anyone who might be on the fence about doing something like this is to just jump in head first! I promise you won't regret it! I couldn't have picked a better studio to experience this with.

My photos are amazing, sexy, and classy. Daphne and Winter I thank you both so much from the bottom of my heart. I don't think you will ever understand what you ladies did for me or how much it means to me.

I had such an amazing experience with Daphne yesterday. My first impression was how professional she is while being very personable. I felt at ease the whole time. I am glad I did my research and it was so worth it.

When you first get there you get a tour and Daphne shows you some of your portrait options. Then you get to go over all of the outfits you brought.

Next, on to meet Winter,  her makeup artist. From the moment I sat down in her chair I was excited and a bit nervous about what type of butterfly I was going to emerge. She was also very personable and loaded with southern sass. I enjoyed having my hair and make up done professionally, it was my first time. I'm a no-frills country girl. When she handed me the mirror and I got to see myself... I could not believe that was me staring back in the mirror. I looked like me, just improved and glamorous!!

The shoot was incredible! So many suggestions and compliments during about how beautiful you look. You get makeup and hair touch ups and even help with my stockings and shoes. A few minutes into the session and most of my insecurities were gone. Daphne knows what works!

Then you get to see your photos!! You see yourself and are like **OMG** IS THAT ME? Yes girl, it is and you will look smoking hot. I'm a big girl and I was rocking my session.

Thank you so much Daphne for such an amazing experience!

Winter did a wonderful job with my hair and makeup; when I say I was GLOWING, that is not an understatement! My makeup was glamorous without being too over-the-top. My curls lasted all day and even into the next. Throughout the photoshoot, Daphne posed me in ways that made me feel wonderful about my body and was able to highlight some of my best features. She was very encouraging the entire time and let me know how wonderful I was doing.

I would definitely recommend this experience to anyone who is questioning it. It is worth the time and expense. If you decide to do it, I also recommend bringing your own pieces to wear! While Daphne’s closet is extensive, it’s special to wear something of your own that you can wear later on and remember the experience.

text: Beth and Joel offer amazing quality pictures with a professional experience and competitive pricing. Their attention to detail is top notch! Their creativity and keen eye made our wedding picture experience at Sloss Furnaces perfection! We will book them again and again for years to come.

resp.text: Thank you for the review. We LOVED working with you guys on your unique wedding shoot. We always love it when someone has an out of the box idea that we are able to make happen, and yours was super FUN! We hope to work with you guys again soon.

name: Traci Vice
text:
Yellowhammer Photography has been our family's photographer for years. Joel and Beth are a pleasure to work with! They are thorough, very professional and an overall delight to be around. We genuinely look forward to working with them every single time.
Through the years we have had family portraits, my daughters wedding (when he did weddings) and both of my daughters senior portraits. He has also made head-shots for a couple of pageants. All were beautifully edited. Beth and Joel work together to come up with realistic poses that are very natural and flattering for all!
We would never consider looking anywhere else for a photographer- Yellowhammer is the best you can get- I can't say enough great things about them!

resp.text: Thank you so much for this review. We really LOVE working with you guys and always look forward to the next time you may have a milestone requiring photographing. Your family is beautiful and wonderful people and we are just so happy that we have been allowed to capture some of these special moments for you guys!

name: Tina Butts
text: After using Joel on two occasions to do photos for me and my family, I booked a Maternity Session more than 3 months in advance. During that time, I texted him to gain an understanding of what the cost would be. He asked a few questions and then never got back with me. Since I had used him on 2 other occasions (most recently 9 months ago) and his prices were reasonable... and this session would be no more work than the previous sessions, I didn't press the issue and figured we would just discuss it later. Well..when I texted him a month before the event to confirm my date, he mentioned he noticed he had never responded to my text regarding the price.  After asking a few more questions he came back with a price of $800?!?!?!??? This is almost as much as I paid for my wedding pictures and they were ABSOLUTELY GORGEOUS with tons of editing (much better than any session that we had with Joel). I have spoken with several licensed photographers since this time and NONE of them charge anywhere near this high. Going price for this type of session was $150-450 for a 1-2 hr session and digital photos (Max). Unfortunately this put me in a real bind because now it was extremely hard to find another photographer that was available for my date. Joel mentioned he would come down to $550...but this was still higher than "average". This high pricing also was not in line with the pricing on his website. Although he did not have Maternity specifically listed, he had Engagement Sessions for the same length of time (2 hr session and digital photos) for $400 and this was synonymous to my requested session since it would be only me and my husband for a couple of hours. Given that he put me in such a stressful bind at an already stressful time in my life, I would definitely NOT recommend him. I tried to work out the pricing with him to be more reasonable and even explained my issue of having troubles finding someone else this late...but he was unwilling to work with me...even though he knew that it was his fault because he never answered my text regarding pricing 3+ months ago. Do yourself a favor...use someone who responds to text messages and honors pricing listed on their website. At a minimum,  select someone who is willing to take responsibility when they make a mistake...that unfortunately does not appear to be Joel at Yellowhammer. :(

resp.text: Thanks for taking the time to share your feedback. We have always enjoyed working with you and your family and are glad you were so pleased with our work in the past that you decided to reach out to us for your maternity session. While we strive to accommodate almost any budget, we understand that sometimes that does not work out. While we do offer lower-priced photography collections, those price points do not include the digital copies of edited photographs that you requested. We hope you were able to use one of the many photographers we recommended, who may be able to offer a lower price point. Thanks again for your business, and we wish you all the best in the future.

name: Amata Hinkle
text:
I had a wonderful rainbow hair balyage vivid color dye job from Krysten (she goes by nerdy mermaid hair). I am careful about covid and she made a slot for me at the end of the day so the salon would be empty and we of course both wore masks. The salon is super clean and she did an amazing job!

A++ 100% five stars 10/10 would go to Krysten again. She set up my hair too for long term, the way it is coloured was done to last / fade nicely (so long as I care for it right!) and once super-faded it won't look weird AND she mentioned some cost-effective ways she can help me maintain vivid colour long-term. I also wear it in a single braid a lot, so she did it in a way that would look rainbow even braided (she did a great job of asking all the right questions to understand how i wear my hair and what my hair goes through on an 'average day/week' so it will look great and last!)

I come from decade-plus of manic panic/punky/etc I did on my own hair (no major bleaching, as that scared me, my hair isn't that dark so high pigment darker colour vivids worked fine) I was just too worried to mess it up to do a rainbow on my own head. So glad I went to Krysten / Nerdy Mermaid and probably won't ever bother doing it myself again!

I am writing this review almost a month after it was coloured and it is still just as vibrant. First photo I took before first wash, second almost a month later.

name: Chris Autwell
text:
Oof, why are you not retaking these photos if they look bad? My 5 year old's first school picture is terrible because whoever took it captured the photo of her in the middle of her smiling.

I also saw a Facebook group of the same school complaining about their kids having food on their face, their shirts folded up, and their hair messed up.

Please be more considerate of other people's children because these photos are our memories.

resp.text: Thank you for your comment? We are sorry your child's portrait did not meet your expectations. You are welcome to call your school to find out when they have scheduled a makeup day to have your child's portrait re-taken. We are given a very short time slot to photograph several hundred students when we are at your school so as not to disrupt the class time. They want us in and out as quickly as possible. Due to the nature of our business, we have a policy that our staff is instructed not to touch students or be responsible for their grooming. We do make suggestions to students, especially older ones, when we see an issue with hair or clothing. It would be helpful if the school would assign a teacher or aid to check the students prior to their sitting being taken. If parents were allowed to be present during the sittings, it would take three times as long to do the pictures.

name: Richard Schlinkert
text: I took in about thirty 35mm slides to transfer to digital, and while they turned the order around quickly, the slides had dust and lint in them and were very low resolution for the cost, which is about twice what the mail-in services charge for twice the resolution.  Unless you are in a hurry, look elsewhere

resp.text:
Thank you for sharing your experience with us.  We're sorry that the final results of your scanning order did not meet your expectations.  We pride ourselves on giving each order personal attention and all of the work we do is done in our Birmingham location (in the historic Avondale neighborhood).
We recall your order very clearly.  You chose our PROOF quality (700 ppi) for your slide scanning order, which our lowest resolution (and lowest priced).  We also offer ARCHIVE quality scans (1700 ppi) at a slighlty higher cost.  Our scanning service, whether Proof or Archive level, includes the utilization of dust removal software, which can remove superficial debris and blemishes on the scanned images.
Our technician specifically noted the high concentration of dust on your slides before scanning your slides.  Prior to scanning your order, our tech  attempted to manually clean each of your slides by hand to remove the dust and lint you described.  Unfortunately, dust and lint are often stuck to the film itself and may not be removed except by rewashing or physically wiping the film with a chemical solution.
We are generally unwilling to do such aggressive cleaning, out of fear we might damage our clients irreplaceable originals.  More often, if the condition of the originals is so bad that our usual cleaning and post-production are insufficient, we can do restorastion to the scanned images.  This digital retouching is not inexpensive, but for extremely valuable or badly deteriorated images, it is often the best option.
Again, we're sorry to hear you were not completely satisfied with our service.  We would welcome the opportunity to regain your confidence.

If I could give Munoz photography more than 5 stars, I would. We had the pleasure of working with Armando on our big day. He was fun and light hearted, yet also extremely professional and skilled. There is not one thing that I would change about my experience with him. From the portraits to the candid moments, he captured every moment with both detail and whimsy. By the end of the night, he felt like family. We got a few of the photos back the day after the wedding and we were STUNNED. He captured emotion so flawlessly. It was important to me that pictures were emotional, high quality and artistic and he delivered on every front.

For anyone who is looking for a true artist with an amazing eye for capturing your most precious moments, Armando is the only photographer for you. Thank you, Armando!!

text: As soon as i got engaged, i was recommended Munoz photography to shoot my wedding. The pricing was a little over our budget so i went with another photographer. The other photographer did our engagement pics and i was very disappointed to say the least. So the next day i immediately called Marc & they still had June 5th available! THE BEST DECISION I EVER MADE!!!! Armando shot our wedding and he did AMAZING. Everyone that was in the wedding talked about how awesome he was with everyone and everything. I couldn’t have asked for anything more from him. He was so much fun & made me feel at ease as soon as he started snapping pictures. HIGHLY RECOMMEND. YOU WILL NOT REGRET IT!!!!

name: Randa Whitaker
text: Marc was the first vendor we booked for our wedding day, and was referred by a trusted friend (Hodges Wedding Venue). I haven't lived in the area in 15 years, but wanted to get married at home and was forced to book strangers to carry out my day (super nerve racking). I booked  without consulting my father because I didn't want to risk Munoz Photography being booked. My dad has no idea what anything cost, and was blown away by photography cost (not in a good way). If this is what you are thinking after speaking to photographers, meet with Marc and Jessica. They are artist, they know photography, but they also know weddings like no other vendor I spoke too. After my dad met with them he asked me if we were paying them enough. DON'T SKIMP ON YOUR WEDDING PHOTOGRAPHER! People said this to me and I rolled my eyes, but now I am right there with them. I just didn't understand the role a photographer played on that day, and now I know it is a big one. These pictures help me relive that day over and over, and they are so beautiful!
